---
title: "Goby Model DAG"
format: html
---

Below is the causal diagram for the simplified Goby model. It includes a latent variable `U` as a common cause for environmental drivers and a correlated error term between `Rain` and `Wind`.

```{mermaid}
%%| fig-width: 8
%%| fig-cap: "Causal DAG for the Goby abundance model. The latent variable U represents unobserved 'ecosystem health' for each zone."

graph TD
    %% --- Style Definitions ---
    classDef latent fill:#f9f9f9,stroke:#aaa,stroke-dasharray:4
    classDef outcome fill:#d9534f,stroke:#c9302c,color:white
    classDef predictor fill:#5bc0de,stroke:#46b8da,color:white
    classDef data fill:#eee,stroke:#ccc

    %% --- Node Definitions ---
    subgraph "Unobserved"
        U(U - Ecosystem Health)
    end
    
    subgraph "Environmental Drivers"
        Rain; Wind; Breach; Temp; DO; SAV
    end

    subgraph "Outcome"
        Goby
    end

    %% --- Causal Paths ---
    U --> Rain
    U --> Wind
    U --> Breach
    U --> Temp
    U --> DO
    
    Rain --> Breach
    Breach --> Temp
    Wind --> Temp
    Temp --> DO
    DO --> Goby
    SAV --> Goby

    %% Correlated Error for weather variables
    Rain <--> Wind

    %% --- Apply Styles ---
    class U latent
    class Goby outcome
    class Rain,Wind,Breach,Temp,DO,SAV predictor
```
